newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani stocks end up on hope of stability.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani stocks end up on hope of stability.

text.p: Pakistani stocks ended up on Tuesday's settlement day on fresh buying by investors on hopes of political stability after parliament curbed presidential powers to sack it and governments, dealers said.
The Karachi Stock Exchange (KSE) 100-share index ended 18.90 points, or 1.20 percent, up at 1,593.60 amid 146 losers and 110 gainers. Volume fell to 42 million shares from Monday's 43 million.
Foreign investors will be able to invest for a long term after the constitutional amendment by the parliament, dealer Yasin Lakhani said.
